results.definition: choose or elect as a fellow member or colleague
examples: The church members co-opted individuals from similar backgrounds to replenish the congregation

results.definition: neutralize or win over through assimilation into an established group
examples: We co-opted the independent minority tribes by pulling them into the Northern Alliance
The army tried to co-opt peasants into civil defence groups

results.definition: take or assume for one's own use
examples: He co-opted the criticism and embraced it
